item.title: Toptal: Xamarin Developers
item.description:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for a Xamarin Developer passionate about creating highly performant, scalable, cross-platform, and feature-rich mobile applications for Android and iOS. Your primary responsibility will be to build production-ready, Xamarin-based mobile applications for a large variety of industry-leading clients. To do this position, you must have a deep love for creating top quality C#-based mobile applications for Android and iOS.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:
  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the development of iOS and Android applications using Xamarin, including writing and maintaining code, creating unit tests, collaborating with team members, and leading teams as necessary.
  • Ensure the highest level of quality throughout the mobile software development life cycle.
  • Use C# and Xamarin best practices to ensure the same quality of applications across multiple platforms with minimal duplication of effort.
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code.
  • Design, build, and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable C# code.
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Extensive experience developing mobile applications for both Android and iOS, including a deep understanding of the differences between them and the nuances of working with each.
  • Extensive experience building mobile applications using C# and the Xamarin framework, including familiarity with the APIs available with Xamarin.
  • Excellent object-oriented programming skills in C#.
  • Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes.
  • Strong knowledge of iOS SDK and experience with Xcode.
  • Experience with integration of web services into mobile applications, including a record of working with SOAP, REST, JSON, and XML.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.
  • Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”.
  • Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers.
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications.
  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

item.title: Idyllic Software Inc: Ruby on Rails Coach & Speaker
item.description:
Headquarters: Pune, India
URL: http://www.idyllic-software.com

Job Description

If you have done enough development in past life and now at a point where you want to share your learnings while exploring deeper into best practices, learn new technologies at your own pace and not be accountable for any code deliverables, then this position is for you.

At Idyllic Software, we thrive on delivering excellence to our customers. We are a Design and Development boutique focussed on Ruby on Rails and Mobile engineering. Our team of 50 designers and developers is located in India. Do not worry, we are not asking you to move here at all and it is a Work From Home role with some travel.
At a high level, your role would be defined as below:

  • Coach and Mentor existing and new team members.
  • Design curriculum on an ongoing basis.
  • Give tech talks in the US to represent us.

As a coach, your job would be to conduct sessions on writing better software for the existing team and creating the course from for the fresh top talent that we hire. You could choose to recommend books, videos or simply conduct sessions for the later. As long as you could evaluate if they are ready to be part of real customer project playing secondary team members.

Your key role is to ensure that as a company, our team is capable of delivering excellence. You are free to dig deeper into suggesting and setting up better processes. We use Kanban and Scrum for most projects and can surely leverage on DevOps.

Responsibilities:

  • Work empathetically with new learners and existing team members and coach them through the process of becoming awesome web developers.
  • Build curriculum for the freshers and existing senior team that we have in place.
  • Conduct shorter lectures remotely while performing longer ones here in India.
  • Provide content for lectures, facilitate code reviews, manage student pairing and provide guidance on team projectsCommit to our values of integrity, excellence, growth and humility.

You are an ideal candidate if you have:
  • 5+ years of verifiable work experience in the tech industry
  • Strong and proven commitment to diversity and inclusion in the tech industry
  • 3+ years of Ruby on Rails development
  • High-energy self-starter with innovative/creative capabilities
  • Stellar interpersonal skills
  • High emotional intelligence (EQ)
  • Leadership and group facilitation experience
  • Git and Agile mastery 

It would be great if you have:
  • 1-3 years of teaching experience 
  • Open source contributions
  • Experiment with newer technologies building prototypes
  • Experience giving conference talks
  • Knowledge of the hiring process for developers 

It is a remote position, but you will need to travel to India for 4-6 weeks for training a few times a year.

To apply: Send a resume to jparekh@idyllic-software.com. If you have a video of your speaking engagements, kindly share the link.

item.title: MoveOn.org: Campaign Support Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: None - virtual office!
URL: www.moveon.org

CAMPAIGN SUPPORT ENGINEERTEMPORARY, FULL TIME • STARTS ASAP, ENDS NOV 30 • COMPETITIVE PAY • EXCELLENT BENEFITS • WORK FROM ANYWHERE IN THE CONTINENTAL US
Help make a difference this election!

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in the 2016 election, MoveOn is investing even more deeply in supporting our campaign team to use technology that amplifies ordinary people’s voices in our democracy. We are hiring a passionate problem solver who will work with campaigners to run innovative campaigns using top-of-the-line political technology, digital campaigning tools and data analysis. Do you love working at the intersection of progressive organizing and technology? Join our team! Together we will create impactful campaigns of massive scale. Join us for the election season and work alongside MoveOn’s core team of organizers, campaigners, data scientists, and software engineers on projects that make the world a more progressive place!

Technology is a core part of our DNA. As we prepare for election season, we need a campaign support engineer to work side by side with campaigners through the election to help them master new tools and take these tools to the limits of their ambitious imaginations.

The MoveOn team works and lives in communities around the country, providing employees tremendous flexibility to live and work anywhere in the continental United States. MoveOn staff are embedded in the communities that make up America, and we pursue the healthy development of community and social connections outside our work lives.

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly get up to speed and develop mastery in the online campaigning platform ActionKit
  • Work side by side with MoveOn team members on complex digital organizing tasks like creating targeted emails, surveys, donation forms, and live event recruitment pages.
  • Help MoveOn team members edit HTML on campaign webpages.
  • Write SQL and use data analysis tools to support team members with campaign reporting.
  • Train MoveOn team members on complex workflows that use online campaigning tools.
  • Contribute your ideas to tech team discussions to enhance and improve our digital campaigns.

Required skills and experience:

  • Working knowledge of SQL in a relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL
  • Experience editing HTML and CSS, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • A strong interest in learning and developing expertise in new technical tools, frameworks, and software.
  • Able to fluently communicate with both technical and campaign staff, and communicate technical information to a diverse audience
  • Determined and thorough- see projects through from idea to implementation to launch, supporting MoveOn team members through the whole process.
  • Curious, and a fearless learner and problem solver.
  • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely.

Location: Position may be based anywhere in the continental United States.
Classification, Salary, and Benefits:  Temporary, Full-time, competitive salary including benefits such as 100%-employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for all staff and their children; employer-paid premiums for life insurance for all staff; four weeks accrued paid vacation time per year; 12 weeks of paid maternity or paternity leave, 10 days accrued paid sick time; and reimbursement of office expenses.  

To apply: Go to https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1EcaYfT4PxoX4ynX3b3rU1EVV7AYDey7-ddpY_lnZ4SM/viewform to submit your application, resume, and cover letter. MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

item.title: Toptal: Ruby on Rails Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://bit.ly/29RiYbj

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for a Ruby on Rails developer to be responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and users. Your primary focus will be to develop all server-side logic, define and maintain the central database, and ensure high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating front-end elements built by other team members into the application, so a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s, with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:
  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.
  • Integrate data storage solutions, including databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.
  • Integrate user-facing elements built by your front-end developer teammates with server side logic.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
  • Optimize applications for speed and scalability.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Senior-level Ruby on Rails expertise, along with strong experience in common libraries such as RSpec and Resque.
  • Strong understanding of the syntax of Ruby and its nuances.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
  • Experience with server-side templating languages such as Liquid, Slim, etc.
  • Experience with server-side CSS preprocessors such as Sass.
  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
  • Familiarity with MVC, Mocking, ORM, and RESTful principles and best practices.
  • A knack for writing clean, readable Ruby code.
  • Ability to integrate multiple data sources and databases into one system.
  • Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.
  • Ability to create database schemas that represent and support business processes.
  • Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN.
  • Familiarity with tools to aid development such as Bower, Bundler, Rake, etc.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/29RiYbj

item.title: Toptal: Drupal Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://www.toptal.com

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for senior Drupal developers to be responsible for front-end development and theming. This position requires a combination of programming skills (PHP, HTML, CSS, JS, etc.) and aesthetics (understanding element arrangements on the screen, the color and font choices, and so on). The best candidates will have a strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems. Experience with responsive and adaptive design is strongly preferred. In addition, an understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development and deployment, with some back-end knowledge, is preferred.
By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s, with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:

  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:

  • Formulate effective, responsive designs and turn them into working themes.
  • Work closely with back-end developers and customers to ensure an effective, visually appealing, and intuitive implementation.
  • Design and implement new features and functionalities, including establishing and guiding the website’s architecture to ensure high performance and availability.
  • Manage all technical aspects of the CMS, and work closely with front-end developers and stakeholders to ensure visually appealing and intuitive implementations.
  • Handle custom Drupal programming and web application development needs, including maintaining and extending Drupal modules and sites.
  • Integrate open source and third-party applications into existing systems as needed.
  • Assess client requirements and convert needs into an elegant, intuitive architecture that meets Drupal best practices.
  • Write reusable, testable, and efficient code.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Strong experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications.
  • Experience building responsive websites using Drupal CMS, HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • Experience developing web solutions in Drupal and PHP implementations in a LAMP environment.
  • Ability to architect enterprise Drupal solutions including data, display, and information architecture.
  • Advanced site-building experience, including deep familiarity with Drupal modules such as CTools, Views, and Panels.
  • Experience creating custom Drupal modules, working with key contributed modules, and making use of the core API.
  • Deep knowledge of PHP, PHP files and theme functions, and the Drupal theme layer.
  • Through understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (e.g. Requirements, Design, Development, Testing) and exposure to Agile or iterative SDLCs.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/1Ua1x00

item.title: Revenviews.com: Senior PHP Coder - Full Time - 100% Remote - EU Time Zone
item.description:
Headquarters: Netherlands
URL: https://revenviews.com

                                     Important - Please state on the mail subject the country you Live in.

We are looking for highly motivated experienced individual with a pleasant personality and good organizational skills to work as a PHP developer. We have a cool team of dedicated employees from around the world. Each one of us works separately from home BUT we function as a team!  The Whole is Greater than the Sum of its Parts. We create amazing products together with no countries or language barriers. We don't care about degrees, color, race or even a bad sense of humor… If you are from the right time zone,(EU), got motivation to build great products and prefer to work full time from the comfort of your home, please apply.

                                  Important - Please state on the mail subject the country you reside.

Required Qualifications:
  • 7 + Years experience in PHP / MySQL
  • Linux administration
  • PostgreSQL knowledge
  • 1+ years in MVC JavaScript
  • Ability to work using existing code and upgrading it
  • Teamwork
  • Good knowledge of English, speaking & writing
  • Experience in high-traffic, production environment

Preferred, but not mandatory:

  • Smarty templating experience
  • Nodejs is a plus
  • Scripting with perl/shell scripts
  • Experience with SQL optimization
  • Experience with CSS and Javascript

How should you apply for this job?

  • Only applications written in English are going to be processed!
  • Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.
  • WE will not reply to 3rd party software agencies
  • We are currently accepting only  candidates from European time zones  
  • Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!
  • Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.

Application process:

  • Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.
  • We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.
  • 1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!

What we offer:

  • Job location is in Cyberspace.
  • Communication with the all team members is done through Skype
  • Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.
  • Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer
  • Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)
 

If you are interested in working with us, please send your complete CV incl. your last jobs and a list of visible references of web projects (link to github account or zip with non-minified code samples) .

Please send to jobs@revenviews.com

To apply: Send a resume to jobs@revenviews.com - Please state on the mail subject the country you Live in.

item.title: DriverReach: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: Indianapolis, IN
URL: http://www.driverreach.com/

We’re a small group of passionate development geeks working on an up-and-coming software startup called DriverReach in the fast-growing trucking industry.

There are a lot of challenging issues and features for a talented Ruby on Rails developer to tackle. You’ll be working alongside the rest of the team and collaborating on feature development.

We’re a 100% remote team, that takes care to do good upfront design (specs and wireframes) before starting to code and have a lot of fun working on the project.

You’ll be a good fit if you:

  • Are self-disciplined and have a great work ethic
  • Have good time management skills
  • Communicate well
  • Love to learn new things and are willing to take direction
  • Can work until 1pm EDT M - F (if not based in the U.S.)

Requirements:

  • Ruby on Rails
  • JavaScript
  • jQuery
  • SQL
  • Git
  • MySQL
  • Unit tests
  • Memory profiling
  • Performance profiling
  • TDD
  • Background workers
  • Writing design docs / specs
  • Wireframing
  • Caching
  • API implementation

To apply: Send your resume and the answers to the questions below to jaredbrown@gmail.com. Answer the following questions: 1. Are you available full-time? 2. Will this be the only project you are working on? 3. Can you work until 1pm EDT each weekday so that there is some overlap with the team members here in the United States? (If not located in the U.S.) 4. We work as a team and are available via group chat while working. All major decisions and features are discussed prior to code being written. It is important to have worked in a team-based setting before and being open to discussion and debate. Is this OK and have you worked in a team before? 5. Each team member uses Hubstaff to track their time and sends a status update via email at the end of each day. Is this OK? 6. Have you worked on a project remotely before? 7. Can you send me links to your GitHub, StackOverflow, and LinkedIn profiles? 8. Do you have any sample code I could take a look at? 9. Can you give us 2 - 3 references to speak with? (names and emails) 10. We want to work with each of our team members for years to come. Are you interested in this project going on for multiple years?

item.title: MyFyx: Experienced Full-Stack Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: https://www.myfyx.com

MyFyx is looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to help connect people with music. MyFyx is a social music platform that amplifies the connective power of music in a unique way. MyFyx also provides artists with a novel distribution and funding model.

As a Full-Stack Developer at MyFyx, you'll be responsible for the day-to-day development and infrastructure operations. MyFyx maintains a variety of products; we have a pair of recently released iOS and Android mobile applications built with React Native, as well as a web site running on Ruby on Rails. We have a variety of backend services facilitating the mobile apps running on Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes. We believe in using the right tool for the right job, and constant progression.

Our stack:
  • React Native with NuclearJS
  • Node.js
  • Golang
  • Elasticsearch
  • Redis
  • MongoDB
  • Ruby on Rails
  • AngularJS (1.x)
  • Kubernetes on GCP via Google Container Engine
  • Heroku

By joining MyFyx, you'll get significant input into production direction and features. We are a completely distributed company with flexible work hours.

About You:
  • Experience with modern Javascript (ES6 and beyond) and Javascript app architectures
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience designing and implementing backend services and APIs
  • Experience with managing deploys and infrastructure, monitoring
  • Experience with NoSQL datastores
  • Strong incite into user experience and interface design, awareness of standard iOS and Android component design patterns
  • Down to earth, easy to work with
  • Consider yourself a generalist engineer and are willing to wear many hats, sometimes at the same time
  • Comfortable with "owning" products / features and ideally have experience with being responsible for the entire end-to-end development process
  • Comfortable and willing to learn as you go. There's probably pieces of our stack you haven’t worked with before, and that's okay as long as you’re confident enough to learn as necessary.
  • Excited to work with a small team and have lots of input in product direction

It would be a big plus if you have had experience working with with some of the following:
  • Experience with any of the technologies used in our stack
  • Building products with React Native or React
  • Flux architecture. We use NuclearJS, but knowledge of Redux / Reflux / etc. will transfer easily
  • Functional Javascript libraries (e.g. Ramda, Immutable)
  • Swift, Objective C, and native iOS app development
  • Java and native Android app development
  • Prior experience working remotely

To apply: Send a resume and cover letter to hiring@myfyx.com

item.title: Perfect Abstractions LLC: Talented Software Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Folsom, California

Looking for a good programmer.

Must be good technically and have good verbal and written communication skill.

Must be able to research, learn and figure out new programming and development technologies quickly.

This position is at a small software development company that is growing. The job can be done remotely.

The position requires programming solutions with Python, Java, Java Swing and databases such as MySQL and SQL Server.

You will learn a software platform called Ignition to implement custom software solutions for manufacturing companies. 
More information here: http://www.perfectabstractions.com/about-ignition.html

Please complete the following test:
Requirements:
1. Below is some data in a text format called Format 1. Below that is some data in a text format called Format 2. Write a program that converts the data from Format 1 to Format 2.
2. Format 2 is valid JSON.
3. The data in Format 1 can be a string value in the program.
4. The program should print out the data in Format 2.
5. The program should be written in such a way that if different data in Format 1 was input into the program the program would convert and print out successfully that data in Format 2.
6. The program must be written in Python, using Jython 2.5.3

The quality of your code will be judged by these factors:
1. Does the program meet the requirements?
2. How simple, readable and understandable it is.
3. How much code is used (less code is better).
4. How much duplicate code exists (less duplicate code is better)
5. Correctly uses built-in functionality and capabilities of Python and/or Java.
6. How efficient the code is (space and time).

Respond to this post if you have questions about the requirements.

After completing the test respond with information about yourself and/or a resume and send the complete test program you wrote.

Data in Format 1:
data = """

S2F3 
accept reply: true
L,3
ASC,"This is some text that 
gets to the next line
and the next line and possibly any number of lines." 
L,3
integer,6
bool,true
float,5.21
L,2
ASC,"More text"
L,1
integer,8

S10F11
accept reply: false
asc,"test2"

S9F1
accept reply: false
L,0

S1F15
accept reply: true
L,4
bool,true,false,true,true,false
Integer,3,5,6,3,7,2,6 
float,9
L,3
integer,4
L,2
float, 4.6,9.3

bool, false
L,2
L,1
L,2
integer,5
L,0
L,3
asc,"test3"
asc,"test
4"
L,0

"""

Format 2
The program should generate and print out this result. Remember that this should be valid JSON.
Here it is:
[{"header":{"stream":2,"function":3,"reply":true},"body":[{"format":"A","value":"This is some text that\ngets to the next line\n and the next line and possibly any number of lines."},[{"format":"U4","value":6},{"format":"Boolean","value":true},{"format":"F4","value":5.21}],[{"format":"A","value":"More text"},[{"format":"U4","value":8}]]]},{"header":{"stream":10,"function":11,"reply":false},"body":{"format":"A","value":"test2"}},{"header":{"stream":9,"function":1,"reply":false},"body":[]},{"header":{"stream":1,"function":15,"reply":true},"body":[{"format":"Boolean","value":[true,false,true,true,false]},{"format":"U4","value":[3,5,6,3,7,2,6]},{"format":"F4","value":9},[{"format":"U4","value":4},[{"format":"F4","value":[4.6,9.3]},{"format":"Boolean","value":false}],[[[{"format":"U4","value":5},[]]],[{"format":"A","value":"test3"},{"format":"A","value":"test\n4"},[]]]]]}]

To apply: Send the test program and information about yourself to nick@perfectabstractions.com

item.title: Packlane: Full-Stack Software Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
URL: http://packlane.com

Packlane helps businesses create impactful custom packaging online, and you help create the powerful code that makes it possible. We’d be OK with you wearing a brightly colored cape at your desk, because you have X-ray vision for detecting bugs and a utility belt full of tools to eradicate them.

You understand that software analysis, design, documentation and programming are essential to the continued prosperity of our business — and also result in web experiences more forceful than a locomotive. Join our team as a software engineer and put your super-skills to work for good.

What You’ll Do:

• Ideate. Create. Innovate. Use your awe-inspiring Elixir-JavaScript-Phoenix-Ansible-MongoDB powers to help our small (but ultra-productive!) team build new and wonderful products. 

• Set up and manage development, staging and production environments.

• Utilize continuous integration to keep the bugs out.

• Develop and maintain internal API’s, biz-intel dashboards and data pipelines.

• Build WebGL-enabled customization interfaces that are always faster than a speeding bullet.

• Bend steel with your bare hands (optional).

Who You Are:

• Mild-mannered, well-organized and highly self-motivated, because you’ll be working remotely. 
• A wiz at configuring, deploying and maintaining NGINX.
• Reliable. Accountable. Dependable. And all the other good -ables. You know what they are.

To apply: https://packlane.workable.com/jobs/279701/candidates/new

item.title: Signifyd: Sheriff
item.description:
Headquarters: San Jose, CA.
URL: www.signifyd.com

Our engineers build systems that catch bad guys.  Using all available payment, user, and machine data, we have to separate legitimate credit card transactions from fraudulent in under 400ms.  That means doing just-in-time mash-ups of internal data with external APIs and reducing it all into a single score with a few critical insights for end-users.
To solve this problem, we're looking for world-class engineers who are eager to learn, adopt, and contribute to a reactive style of programming.  The position is for a backend engineer and will involve architecting and building scalable, event-driven fraud detection systems.

Required Skills:
  • Excellent programming skills in Java or similar language
  • Experience with scripting languages and SQL
  • Analytical problem solving skills
Bonus Skills:
  • Experience building large-scale high-performance systems
  • Startup experience
  • Payments or risk experience
  • Machine learning or related knowledge
Typical Education:
  • B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or other technical field
  • Alternatively, an excellent open-source contribution history (highlight in application)
Our stack:
  • Java, Python, Cassandra, MySQL, Solr, Apache Spark, Play! framework, Docker, fleet, AWS
Who We Are

Signifyd was founded on the belief that e-commerce businesses should be able to grow without fear of fraud. Signifyd solves the challenges that growing e-commerce businesses persistently face: billions of dollars lost in chargebacks, customer dissatisfaction from mistaken declines, and operational costs due to tedious, manual transaction investigation. E-Commerce Assurance, Signifyd’s financial guarantee protecting online retailers in case of chargebacks, is supported by a full-service cloud platform that automates fraud prevention allowing businesses to increase sales and open new markets while reducing risk. Signifyd is in use by multiple companies on the Fortune 1000 and Internet Retailer Top 500 list. Signifyd is headquartered in San Jose, CA.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

To apply: You can apply directly at our careers page, https://www.signifyd.com/careers/?gh_jid=44015

item.title: Clevertech: Driven JavaScript / Node.js Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: New York City
URL: why.clevertech.biz

About You
You're comfortable with Node.js and front-end development in general.

You love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You’re looking for projects that you'll be proud to share with your friends and family, and you're interested in scaling large projects that disrupt markets and build business.

You know when to ask more questions and where to look for answers.

If you're not looking to advance your skills and work along Senior Developers committed to helping you do that, this isn't for you!

About Clevertech
15 years developing apps has taught us this: Build people, then products.

We’re aware that solid engineering practices and our love of Agile principles aren’t enough to ensure that we translate our clients’ dreams into software that shapes the world.

Our team of nearly 100 developers and designers are what make it possible.

They’ve rejected offers from Google and Twitter. They’re parents, travelers, or aspiring entrepreneurs. Some are in the planning stages of launching their own startups. Here’s what they have in common:

They’re all invested in becoming better together and we support their constant learning.

For more on how we do this, check out why.clevertech.biz. Some of the great things we do together are captured in cleverte.ch/bloomberg and visualcaptcha.net.

About the Job
At Clevertech, we understand why it’s great to be part of the gig economy—we also understand some of the challenges it can present.

By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!

Here’s how it works:

  • We work with quality clients who have brilliant ideas they want to scale, scale, scale :)
  • You can be located anywhere. This is a remote position. (And you're excited about it!)
  • Schedules are flexible—you work when you're in flow
  • You focus on one client at a time; when you're finished with one, we provide another
  • We use the latest tools and streamline every workflow imaginable
  • Everyone on our team shares your culture, irrespective of where they are physically

To apply: Sounds like you? Apply at https://clevertech.biz/careers/54cf696f2b393e216ee20936

You're a master with Node.js and love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You're organized and you don't need to tell people about it. It shows.

You offer fullstack ability, believe the power of open source solutions, and always have scalability in the back of your mind.

You can jump into projects, review code, suggest improvements, and create trust in clients. You’re never afraid to get your hands dirty in code.

You can take ownership of a project, fill in the gaps, and ensure production ready releases.

By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!

item.title: Citrusbyte: Experienced Backend Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: Los Angeles & New York, United States
URL: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

Citrusbyte is a software development company which believes in using simple tools to solve all types of problems. We work closely with designers, engineers and our clients to create and improve products of great quality. We have considerable experience building custom systems for both startups and enterprises - check out our portfolio for more information about our clients.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.

Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.

We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.

We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

Skills & Requirements:
  • Smart, gets things done.
  • Passionate about software development.
  • Excellent communication / consulting experience.
  • Open minded and always learning
  • Experience working in a distributed company
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Architect and build web applications.
  • Work with product designers and clients to clarify requirements.
  • Plan and prioritize work in a collaborative remote team.

To apply: You can apply directly at our careers page: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

item.title: Email Hunter: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer — Europe
item.description:
Headquarters: Lyon, France
URL: https://emailhunter.workable.com/jobs/287671

Email Hunter crunches the web's data to allow businesses to connect to each other. More than one hundred thousand users are using our products every week. And our growth continues! We focus on building a powerful, simple and efficient service. We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to help us create the perfect experience for our users.

At Email Hunter, we prefer to spend most of our energy building the best possible product. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

We're looking for a passionate developer to work on the application and help all sales and recruiting people dream of. You will work both on the back-end (in particular our API) and the front facing part of our service. Our service is expanding and you'll be part of building this future.

On a daily basis, you obsess over details. You know that small changes in UI or copywriting can make a big difference on thousands of users using Email Hunter every day. At the same time, you're searching for efficiency. You like to focus on what's essential and solve technical problems with elegant solutions. Simplicity is reflected in both your code and the features you build.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You are based in Europe
  • You write high quality, maintainable and testable code in Ruby on Rails
  • You're very comfortable with JavaScript (bonus points for familiarities with Backbone.js)
  • You have strong English communication skills
  • You are detail-oriented and want to deliver the best experience possible to Email Hunter's users!

BENEFITS

We love working at Email Hunter. We're psyched by what we're building and the context we're doing it in. You'll get the chance to feel the same and take part in the adventure with us. The perks you'll get to enjoy:

  • Remote & flexible work
  • 3 company-paid annual retreats to amazing places
  • Profit sharing
  • Flat hierarchy

To apply: Apply online: https://emailhunter.workable.com/jobs/287671 If you have any question, please contact François: francois@emailhunter.co

item.title: Ridecell : Senior Back end Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: san francisco
URL: www.ridecell.com

We are looking for talented and motivated engineers to join our team here at RideCell who can hit the ground running and take our product to the next level, as we scale up and develop our business in our target markets. The Backend Engineers who are building our Core Platform work across the stack, always willing to go the extra mile to deliver the highest quality in enterprise software. As a developer for RideCell you are building the tools today that will redefine tomorrow's transit. 

The Role

  • Take ownership over project timelines and deliverables
  • Contribute to the design, architecture and build of our Core Platform
  • Help scale the platform and build out new features
  • Contribute to the DevOps process and tool building
  • Contribute to the frontend if and when needed, developing new skills as needed
  • Apply algorithm development to solve deep problems
  • Work with customers when needed
Requirements
  • Fluency in Python & Django or confident that you can get there quickly, and 5+ years experience in another programming language
  • You always leave code better than you found it, and you have opinions on software design.
  • Self-directed, but also work well with other engineers.
  • Excited about working for a startup and moving quickly.
  • 5+ years of experience (internships included)
  • Experience working remotely in the past
  • Must live in the United States

Preferred
  • Front end experience with javascript frameworks like Backbone.js or React.js
  • Experience with RESTful APIs and API design.
  • DevOps experience, especially with AWS, Vagrant, Ansible, and Postgres.

About RideCell
RideCell is the leading provider of software to power mobility-as-a-service (MaaS), including car-sharing, ride sharing, fixed-route, and dynamic transit services. The “Global Call for Transit Innovators” award winner is helping customers reimagine and re-architect transportation in cities, communities and campuses around the world. 
RideCell's unique differentiator is “autonomous fleet operationsTM”: technology that automates end-to-end business operations from consumer apps to the day to day fleet management, demand and supply analytics, marketing, CRM, and payments. Its mobility software platform automates some of the hardest operational tasks in running a transportation system enabling cities, campuses and multi-city mobility providers to launch on-demand, car sharing and fixed-route services in weeks and optimize and scale them without human intervention. In addition to mobility providers such as BMW, RideCell's clients include transit agencies such as Santa Clara VTA in Silicon Valley, companies such as 3M, universities such as UC Berkeley, hospitals such as UCSF.

RideCell is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Key investors include BMW iVentures, Khosla Ventures and YCombinator. RideCell's vision is to help their customers “Run the world, better TM”.

To apply: Send resumes to Richie@Ridecell.com

item.title: WebDevStudios: Back-End WordPress Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: https://webdevstudios.com/jobs/job-application/

WebDevStudios is looking for a remote back-end developer with at least one year advanced WordPress development experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is actively working in the website and plugin development field and is knowledgeable about the most recent releases and standards of WordPress. Applicants should be passionate about WordPress and eager to learn and grow with our company.

Please note: This is not an entry-level position. Experienced programmers only.

Your job duties will include:
  • Developing WordPress plugins, custom functionality, and themes
  • Developing and maintaining complex WordPress-based applications
  • Supporting clients in a fast paced environment
  • Using bug tracking, project tracking, and SVN +/or Git software
  • A variety of miscellaneous development tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish
  • Heavy lifting data, migrations, etc.

Requirements:
  • Excellent knowledge of WordPress, PHP, MySQL, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, and jQuery
  • Good understanding of accessibility considerations and web standards
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Ability to work remotely with little to no supervision is a must
  • Available during the day, Eastern time, Monday through Friday
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to be a team player and grow as business grows
  • Experience using SVN & Git software a plus

Types of projects we’re doing lately:
  • WordPress websites, mainly (some with and some without a blog) for large and enterprise-level businesses, multisite networks, social communities and lots of social media integration.
  • WordPress with eCommerce (WooCommerce experience is a plus)
  • WordPress Multisite and BuddyPress
  • Membership sites with WordPress

(…Do you get a feeling that we do a LOT of WordPress sites??? We do!)

Work Environment:
  • Remote work –  Monday through Friday
  • Office dress code: Pajamas, if you like.
  • This is a full-time, salaried position
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities
  • Lots and lots of informal gif sharing

We’re looking for someone who:
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Likes to have a lot of fun tinkering around inside the guts of cool websites.
  • Gets more kicks out of removing elements from a page than adding them.
  • Wants to learn, push themselves, and make the web a better place to be.
  • Excellent time management and ability to work, remotely, on a deadline and on multiple projects at once.
  • Great critical thinking skills, a good work ethic, and customer service skills.

No third parties or outsourcing agencies will be considered, but we are open to worldwide applicants!

To apply: Apply through our site: https://webdevstudios.com/jobs/job-application/

item.title: Follow Up Boss: Senior Full Stack Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.followupboss.com/

Follow Up Boss is a cutting edge CRM for small businesses. Customers love our product, check what people say about us. You'll be solving real problems for our thousands of daily users that run their businesses on FUB. We're bootstrapped, profitable and growing.

Looking for an experienced full stack engineer to join our small friendly team. You will be working on the new version of Follow Up Boss in React.js while extending our REST API to support new features and improvements. On the backend we use PHP, Postgres, MySQL, Redis, Algolia. Everything is hosted on AWS.

We practice simplified version of Scrum with 1-week sprints for faster development and feedback, chat in Slack daily and meet in person on regular company retreats. Our roadmap is packed with new features and improvements based on solid feedback from customers.

This is a full-time job, choose to work remote or in our San Francisco office.

What We Expect

- Experience working in a fast-growing startup building and shipping a SaaS product.

- Great programming skills, ability to produce quality code that is maintainable, efficient, reliable and secure.

- Excellent knowledge of PHP and MySQL, ability to write complex queries that run fast.

- Good knowledge of JavaScript; experience with React.js is appreciated but not required.

- Linux administration skills, ability to set up and maintain production and dev servers.

- Fluent English and good communication skills.

What You Can Expect

- Solve challenging technical problems and put your skills to the test every day. See direct impact of your work and value you created for customers.

- Work in a small friendly team side-by-side with co-founders. Opportunity to learn all aspects of running a SaaS business.

- Provide direct input on technical (and not so technical) decisions, be heavily involved in the product design process. Your opinion matters, your ideas will be heard and appreciated.

- Flexible work schedule, work when you are the most productive and be with your family when they need you.

- Ability to work 100% remote, enjoy working from the comfort of your own home. We’re hiring the best people regardless of where they live.

- Loose vacation policy, take time off when you need it.

- Competitive compensation, year-end bonuses based on performance, trips to tech conferences and company meetups.

- Your choice of equipment, latest MacBook Pro or anything else you need.

- Monthly perks like Starbucks, WholeFoods, Uber, Movie Tickets, Dashlocker.

- Something else you need? Let us know.

To apply: Apply Now at http://grnh.se/ys3m85

item.title: Boxes: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
item.description:
Headquarters: Miami, FL
URL: https://box.es/careers/engineering-team/senior-ruby-on-rails-engineer

We're a rapidly growing startup processing over 1 million events per day and are looking for an ambitious Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer to join our world-class team. We're building the largest community of collectors and disrupting the convention industry at the same time. You'll have the opportunity to work with incredible engineers, and be a major contributor in the architecture and development of both the Boxes and Tradeshow Platforms.  

If you're looking to be part of something incredibly special then this is your chance. Come join us!

Some Responsiblilites:

  • Implement and take charge of the software architecture and development of the Boxes and Tradeshow Platforms and APIs
  • Define and implement an agile development cycle 
  • Implement an efficient deployment cycle and ensure robust performance
  • Articulate clear goals to meet that strategy and track key metrics to measure success

Some other info:

  • Valuable Stock and Pay

Skills and Requirements:

  • Expertise in Ruby on Rails at its best, through proven track record of several years of experience
  • Real passion, interest and many years of experience in working with technologies like Postgresql & Redis
  • Interest in working with asynchronous web services
  • Enthusiasm for beautiful, pragmatic code and an eye for simplicity
  • Write meaningful tests to ensure confidence in the code base
  • Experience with RVG and ImageMagick a big plus
  • Motivation, talent and endless spirit
  • Ability to integrate into a symbiotic team of young and highly motivated people
  • Must be familar with startup life and willing to contribute long hours 
  • Effective oral and written English communication skills

Visit us:

https://box.es

https://tradeshow.net

To apply: Send your resume and a description about yourself to careers@box.es

item.title: Savvy Apps: Android Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Washington, D.C.
URL: http://savvyapps.com/

Note: We are only reviewing candidates from North America for this position.

Savvy Apps is a top app agency located just outside of Washington, D.C. We work on apps for national brands & high-profile startups and our work is regularly featured on app stores. We have a great culture, generous benefits, and a fun, results-oriented atmosphere (http://savvyapps.com/careers).

Results-oriented Development

Join a team where output is our primary concern. You'll spend almost of all of your time doing what you enjoy: writing code! If you find meetings, management buy-in, office politics, and documentation to justify decisions a drag, then you'll fit in perfectly at Savvy Apps.

We work with tools ranging from GitHub and Pivotal Tracker to having clear mockups and designs instead of long spec documents. To complement our own work, we use open source and commercial frameworks to speed development and create clean, maintainable and testable code. We also expect you to be ecstatic to have access to Google's design resources and always think about the end customer...fight for the users!

Perks...We Got 'Em

Healthcare…check. Vision…check. Dental…check. Plus we have a 401k profit sharing plan. At a minimum, you'll get 3% of your salary contributed by us, regardless if you contribute yourself. We also ensure that you get an ergonomic home office setup and supped up machine when joining the team. At least once a year we gather the entire team for a fun adventure. In the past we've done everything from high speed go kart racing to escape room competitions.

What's Next

Sound interesting? Click that apply link now or learn more about us. We look forward to seeing if you're savvy enough to join...well, Savvy.

To apply: http://savvyapps.com/developer-inquiry

item.title: Xogito: Magento Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Remote
URL: https://www.xogito.com

Driven by the Cogito ergo sum, Xogito is a global citizen company operating worldwide in a virtual environment. Every day we help our clients exceed their business goals and gain invaluable experience of it. 
For our Software Development Team, we are looking for a


Magento Developer
Full time, permanent, remote job


Purpose of the Role
The Magento Developer's main objective is to bring live new e-commerce platforms for established businesses at a growing phase, while working with a top digital talent team in collaborative culture, implement latest technologies and create world class solutions. 

Duties and Responsibilities
Xg Developing new E-commerce platforms from scratch
Xg Developing and maintaining custom web applications built using Magento 2.0
Xg Writing new and extending existing modules
Xg Investigate, analyze and fix reported bugs

Required Experience & Knowledge
Essential
Xg Experience with Object Oriented PHP
Xg Experience with Magento and MVC architectural pattern
Xg Experience with Varnish
Xg Experience with JavaScript and frameworks (jQuery, Prototype, AngularJS)
Xg Experience with Version Control software (Git, SVN)
Xg Experience with Twitter's Bootstrap CSS Framework and HTML
Advantage
Xg Knowledge of optimization, scaling and caching techniques
Xg Create mobile friendly and responsive sites

Skills and Attributes
Xg Solid problem-solving and analytical skills
Xg Excellent time and task management skills
Xg Outstanding teamwork skills
Xg Desire to learn

Required Education & Qualifications
Xg Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer science or related degree
Xg Excellent English communication skills – written and oral

Benefits of winning a career at Xogito
Xg Reward and recognition 
Xg Our remote work model supports the value of family time and the work-life balance 
Xg Payment on top of scale and different kind of bonuses
Xg Career development path synchronized with your professional interests and company strategic goals 
Xg Access to training and certification program supporting your professional objectives achievement 
Xg Regular company off-sites and co-working days
Xg Engagement with global IT society and contributing to the remote work community

As an employer Xogito stands for bringing together and nurturing top digital talent. Our team consists of seasoned IT Professionals who solve with curiosity and excellence extreme technical challenges. We believe that the Agile SWD, TDD, cloud computing and open source technologies are the present and the future of technology.  In our day-to-day activities we adhere to best industry practices and enjoy it. 

...Radical Thinking...

To apply: Apply now by sending a recent version of your CV and SkypeID with subject Reference Number 54-05 to careers@xogito.com All candidates will be contacted within a short period of time.

item.title: Hotjar: Full Stack Developer (EU)
item.description:
Headquarters: Malta
URL: http://www.hotjar.com

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Job Perks:
  • Work remotely from the comfort of your own home
  • A free Kindle and Fitbit when you join Hotjar
  • €3,000 home office budget
  • Yearly personal development budget
  • Access to thousands of online courses
  • Attend conferences around the world
  • Regular company meetups

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

To apply: Apply on http://careers.hotjar.com/o/full-stack-developer.

item.title: Whiplash: Rails Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Oakland, CA
URL: https://whiplashmerch.com

Whiplash is empowering next-generation eCommerce entrepreneurs with simple and powerful warehousing and fulfillment solutions. Our software translates complex retail requirements into simple, failsafe instructions for warehouse employees across the globe.

Our goal is to make life easier for our customers and partners, and to leave them with the “wow” feeling of having solved logistics and fulfillment issues with ease, style and class.

We’re looking for a web developer with strong backend skills to become an expert on the Whiplash platform to help us support, scale, and add to our growing base.

We value hard work, integrity, and a strong moral compass. We were founded 6 years ago and bootstrapped to profitability (and #457 on the Inc 5,000) before accepting funding from Draper Associates (Tesla, Twitter, Skype) in 2016. 

To apply: Send two (2) sentences to apply@whiplashmerch.com to introduce yourself.

item.title: Auth0: Engineer (SDKs & Samples)
item.description:
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
URL: https://auth0.com/jobs

Are you passionate about building tools that help other developers be more productive? Auth0 is looking for SDK engineers to help drive the end-to-end developer experience for various languages and platforms. This is more than just writing code, this is about making sure everyone who uses Auth0 has an amazing experience.

We are looking for somebody who can balance technical requirements, customer needs, and data to constantly drive improvement. In any given day you might handle anything from adding new functionality to an SDK, creating a sample, writing technical documentation, or even jumping in and helping a customer solve a really tough problem. You will be the go to person for a particular language/framework at Auth0.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Creating and maintain our core SDKs. This will include anything from adding new features, updating when new versions of frameworks are released, to fixing bugs reported by customers. You will be responsible for the quality and completeness of the SDKs you oversee.
  • Write end-to-end documentation for your language/framework. At Auth0 we believe that if the customer can't figure out an answer then we need to do better. Your job will be to always improve the docs to make the experience better for our customers. We want security to be easy, you will help make it so.
  • Create meaningful samples that show best practices using Auth0. We want it to be as simple as possible for a developer to go from nothing to having a fully functioning and secure app up and running. You will build samples to guide the way.

Attributes we care about:
  • Motivated - You are excited to build new software. It doesn’t matter if it is front-end, backend, tests, or even maybe a build script. You get it done and you do your job well. You like learning new skills and applying your existing skills to make things happen.
  • Completionist - You ship code. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.
  • Detail Oriented - You’ll need to understand the big picture, but also be keenly aware of the details. When it comes to shipping SDKs and developer docs the details make or break the experience. A simple missing step or line of code can be the difference between a customer loving or leaving our product. You should be the type of person who cares deeply about the details.
  • Problem Solver - You can figure out a problem with little or no guidance. We hire explorers and doers. Given a problem you dive in and find the answer. When presented a challenge you immediately start to think of several solutions. You can't reset until you find the best answer.
  • Highly Technical - You will be the go to person on a particular technology. You are the authority. You need to understand the how and the why. In this role you will need to solve real-world problems, and as such you need to have experience building and shipping real products.

Technical Skills:
We are looking for people who have expertise with the following languages/frameworks. You will focus on one or two of these and should be able to go deep.

  • AngularJS, Angular 2
  • EmberJS, EmberJS 2
  • React, Redux, Fluxible
  • Node.JS, Express, Hapi
  • Java, Spring Security
  • Ruby, Ruby on Rails
  • Python
  • PHP, Laravel
  • iOS
  • Android
  • React Native
  • Ionic, Ionic 2

To apply: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/c518c157-35ca-4f6b-88f1-ff49f1b3f03c/apply

item.title: Ajar Online: Full-Stack Laravel Developer
item.description:
Headquarters: Kuwait City, Kuwait
URL: www.ajar.com.kw

Who we are
Built by a passionate team of problem-solvers, Ajar Online is a mobile-inspired cloud service built for the real estate market in Kuwait and the GCC that uses technology to offer a quick and efficient online rent collection solution via SMS and email, making life easier for both landlords and tenants. As a growing startup, we are excited to start expanding our team to grow our operations in Kuwait and within the region. 

Ajar Online is an awarding-winning startup. Explore what we do in more detail on our website.

What we’re looking for
We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer to design, develop and enhance our core business software solution. The successful candidate will be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design. This job is also available for anyone outside of Kuwait as a "Remote Job"

What you’d have to do
  • Execute full life-cycle software development in a self-sufficient matter.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code
  • Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software systems
  • Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
  • Develop unit tests for self or others code when necessary.
  • Review code for bugs and defects including security loopholes within the logical structures. 
  • Comply with project plans and industry standards
  • Produce reports using MySQL on an “as needed basis”.

Skills
  • BS in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Required ability to swiftly develop software in PHP
  • Experience in developing web applications using at least one popular web framework 
  • Knowledgeable in ORM.
  • Expert in MVC best practices
  • Proficiency in Laravel 4 Framework
  • Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, MySQL using PhpMyAdmin
  • Preferable knowledge in cross-platform mobile development tools
  • Preferable knowledge in one or more of these languages; Java, Objective-C, Swift or C#.
  • Preferable Knowledge in Linux (Ubuntu) Administration

Benefits
Other than the usual benefits;
  • Stock Options.
  • 30 days paid leave.
  • Flexible Hours (with at least 4 hrs overlap with GMT+3).
  • Work remotely from anywhere!

To apply: Use the following link to apply: https://ajaronline.workable.com/j/71257A0749
